lexUnit.name: high.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of a measurement) vertically upward from some baseline

sentence.text: Measuring 51 cm ( 20 in ) in diameter , the table is made from 12 mm ( ) chipboard and stands about 61 cm ( 24 " ) high .
Left : Zanussi 's four-place setting Studio Compact DS10 measures 46 cm high , 45 wide and 48 cm deep .
A standard-size machine measures 60 cm wide , 60 cm deep and 85 cm high .
An adult tiger stands at least 3 ft ( 90 cm ) high at the shoulder .

These thermae covered a very large area , greater than that of the Palace of Westminster , and stood upon an artificial platform some 20 feet high .
It was constructed by Agrippa in 18-19 B.C. and consists of two tiers of arches each about 65 feet high and an upper tier of smaller arches 28 feet high .

Donald was an inch high .
During the selection process berries are bounced along shaking conveyor belts which are crossed with four inch high wooden barriers -- they must be fresh and firm enough to bounce over the boards .
The element in the south gallery is sixty inches high , the element in the north gallery is sixty-eight inches high .

The grass was about seven metres high , and the corn about thirteen metres high .
The hall is two storeys high , with an atrium spilling out plants half-way up and built-in wooden plant holders at ground level in the corners of the marble floor .

The block is three storeys high and my apartment was on the second floor .

Colloquially known as la piscine , so named after the nearby disused les Tourelles swimming pool , the complex of modern and antiquated buildings was hidden behind an eighteen-foot high wall .
